column5: Heading up there next week for season opener. Have never fished there. Can anyone pass on any experiences there? Heard Lake Trout and walleye are good. thanks.

Have fished this region for over 10 years with varying success. The opener can be a real coin toss depending on the weather. If the spawn is late then fishing tends to be a little spotty. With the weather this year, I would hope the fish have already spawned and may be on a bite. Nice thing about the lake trout is that you can catch them in the shallows 10-20 ft on jigs. Am looking forward to getting up there myself sometime in June. Good luck and good fishing..and stay off teh rocks. By the way, where are you staying?
HM, thanks for the info. Staying at Taggert Bay. Should be good for lakers and walleye this time of year. Bringing lots of jigs and floating rapalas.
Where is Kipawa located in Quebec?

Lake Kipawa is located about an hour northeast of North Bay Ontario. The largest town is Temiscaming Quebec. The area if a series of interconnected lakes and rivers. Most of it is only accessible by water or a few old, rough logging roads.On my last trip cell phones still wouldn't work and you can only receive about one or on a good day two radio stations.

Caught lots of walleye and pike. We cought no smallmouth at all...are there smallmouthin the lakes surrounding this area???
